chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall x y : R, in_ucirc x y /\ is_ratp (x, y) -> exists r : R, is_rat r /\ interCDr r x y

Premises:

*** [ R : Set ]
in_ucirc = fun x y : R => (x * x + y * y)%R = 1%R : R -> R -> Prop Arguments in_ucirc (_ _)%R_scope
interCDr = fun r x y : R => in_ucirc x y /\ D_r r x y : R -> R -> R -> Prop Arguments interCDr (_ _ _)%R_scope
is_rat = fun r : R => exists pq : Z * Z, let (p, q) := pq in q <> 0 /\ r = frac p q : R -> Prop Arguments is_rat _%R_scope
rat_coo1 : forall x y : R, in_ucirc x y /\ (exists r : R, is_rat r /\ interCDr r x y) -> is_ratp (x, y)
interCDr_sol : forall r x y : R, interCDr r x y -> eqp (x, y) p1 \/ eqp (x, y) (p2 r)
relp_rat : forall r : R, is_rat r -> (r >= 0)%R -> (r <= 1)%R -> exists pq : Z * Z, let (p, q) := pq in p >= 0 /\ q > 0 /\ p <= q /\ rel_prime p q /\ r = frac p q
not_rel_prime1 : forall x y : Z, ~ rel_prime x y -> exists d : Z, Zis_gcd x y d /\ d <> 1 /\ d <> -1
gcd_rel_prime : forall x y d : Z, Zis_gcd x y d -> exists a b : Z, x = d * a /\ y = d * b /\ rel_prime a b
Rinv_l : forall r : R, r <> 0%R -> (/ r * r)%R = 1%R
Rinv_neq_0_compat : forall r : R, r <> 0%R -> (/ r)%R <> 0%R

original: intros x y [Huc Hir]. destruct Hir as [r [Hr Hinter]]. exists r. split. - auto. - apply Hinter.
